page.title: 01Introduction
page.content: Hyde and Denton are small market towns to the East of Manchester.They are separated by the River Tame which once separated Lancashire from Cheshire and now gives its name to the whole area of Tameside.They owe their initial growth to the,once thriving hatting and cotton industries.These have seriously declined.In addition to the industrial premises,large and small, there are shops, several large super- markets and two town markets. The periferal areas are residential.The last decade has seen the improvement of our linear park,the{Tame Valley as a recreational area.Much new planting has been done, paths laid, trails clearly marked and picnic areas provided. The enjoyment of these, however, is dependant upon the cleaning of the highly polluted River Tame.{
